intro: Laxmannia orientalis, commonly known as the oriental laxmannia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
